resources.name: Inglewood Wrapping Arms Around the Community (IWATC)
resources.description: Nonprofit organization providing wraparound services for people affected by poverty, homelessness, addiction, trauma, and incarceration. Offers crisis intervention with 24-hour hotline, gang intervention and prevention, in-reach programs in prisons across California and juvenile probation camps, and resource center with comprehensive support services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to individuals and families affected by poverty, homelessness, addiction, trauma, and incarceration in the Inglewood community.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Inglewood Wrapping Arms Around the Community IWATC address phone contact'

resources.name: HOPICS - Compton Office
resources.description: Homeless Outreach Program Integrated Care System providing reentry case management, employment services, housing assistance, and wraparound services for justice-involved individuals. R-ICMS model improves health outcomes and reduces recidivism for Los Angeles County residents.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Serves individuals re-entering the community after incarceration, homeless individuals, and those at risk of homelessness in Los Angeles County.
accessibility_features: Serves Compton and South Bay region
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'HOPICS reentry services Los Angeles address phone contact'

resources.name: M.E.N.T.O.R.S., Inc. - Hawthorne ODR Re-Entry Housing
resources.description: 24-bed men's residential reentry facility funded by the Office of Diversion and Re-entry. Provides housing, case management, and supportive services for non-violent ex-offenders transitioning from jails and institutions.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Non-violent ex-offenders transitioning from jails and institutions. Men only. Must be referred through LA County Office of Diversion and Reentry.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'MENTORS Inc Hawthorne 11720 Inglewood Avenue reentry housing phone'

resources.name: Los Angeles Regional Reentry Partnership (LARRP)
resources.description: Countywide network of reentry-focused nonprofits, public agencies, and advocates. Supports development of comprehensive, culturally competent reentry system through policy advocacy, community convening, and resource coordination. Provides strong community voice in public policy and connects service providers.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Serves all justice-involved individuals and families across Los Angeles County through member organizations. Open to reentry service providers seeking to join the network.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles Regional Reentry Partnership LARRP address phone contact Inglewood'

resources.name: South Bay One-Stop Business & Career Center - Gardena
resources.description: Comprehensive workforce development center providing free business services and employment assistance to job seekers in 11 South Bay cities. Offers job training, placement services, career counseling, and resources for adults, youth, veterans, and individuals with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in South Bay region (El Segundo, Gardena, Hawthorne, Hermosa Beach, Inglewood, Lawndale, Lennox, Manhattan Beach, Redondo Beach, Westchester). Serves adults, youth, veterans, and individuals with employment barriers.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'South Bay Workforce Investment Board Gardena AJCC address phone'

resources.name: Center for Employment Opportunities (CEO) - Los Angeles
resources.description: Employment-focused reentry program providing individuals recently released from prison with immediate paid employment, comprehensive job training, ongoing career coaching, and job placement services. Ensures people returning from prison can build career capital and achieve financial stability.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals recently released from incarceration who are seeking immediate employment and career support. Must be committed to working and building career skills.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Center for Employment Opportunities CEO Los Angeles address phone contact'

resources.name: St. Joseph Center - Venice
resources.description: Multi-service organization helping people transition out of homelessness through permanent supportive housing, rapid re-housing, coordinated entry system for families, mental health services, food assistance, job training, and comprehensive case management. Serves over 10,000 people annually across LA County.
services_offered: Move-in assistance and short-term rental subsidies
resources.eligibility_requirements: Homeless individuals, families with children, and those at risk of homelessness on the Westside. Services prioritized through coordinated entry system.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'St. Joseph Center Venice 204 Hampton Drive housing services'

resources.name: The People Concern - SAMOSHEL (Santa Monica Shelter)
resources.description: Interim housing program providing transitional shelter for individuals moving out of homelessness. Offers comprehensive services including meals, case management, housing assistance, and support services to help participants obtain jobs and secure permanent housing. Referrals only, no walk-ins.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals transitioning out of homelessness in Santa Monica area. Accessible through referrals only - cannot accommodate walk-ins. Contact for referral process.
accessibility_features: Closed 1st and 2nd Wednesday of each month
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'The People Concern SAMOSHEL Santa Monica address phone'

resources.name: Venice Community Housing Corporation
resources.description: Affordable and permanent supportive housing provider serving low-income residents in Venice and Mar Vista. Offers comprehensive on-site supportive services including job training, youth development, after-school tutoring, case management, and family stabilization programs to help vulnerable community members achieve stability.
services_offered: Case management for families experiencing homelessness
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income residents in west Los Angeles area (Venice, Mar Vista). Priority for families experiencing homelessness. Youth services for ages 16-24.
resources.fees: Affordable rent based on income for housing programs
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Venice Community Housing Corporation 720 Rose Avenue services'

resources.name: West Adams WorkSource Center
resources.description: LA Economic & Workforce Development Department center providing free employment services including job training, career counseling, computer and telephone access, and literacy skills workshops. Specializes in serving the reentry population with comprehensive workforce development resources.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Los Angeles, with specialized services for the reentry population. Services always free.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Baldwin Hills Crenshaw reentry employment services Los Angeles'

resources.name: Compton WorkSource Center
resources.description: California State Employment Development Department center providing comprehensive workforce development services to businesses and job seekers free of charge. Offers employment assistance, job listings, career counseling, and training program connections. Comprehensive One-Stop Career Center serving the Compton and Rancho Dominguez area.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Compton and surrounding areas. Services provided free of charge to individuals with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'California State Employment Development Department Compton WorkSource Center 2909 Pacific'

resources.name: Phoenix House Venice
resources.description: Comprehensive substance abuse treatment facility providing residential and outpatient services for adult men. Offers 90-day inpatient rehab, long-term residential treatment, short-term residential treatment, inpatient dual diagnosis treatment, and withdrawal management services. Licensed and Drug Medi-Cal certified, CARF accredited.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adult men (18+) with substance use disorders. Serves persons with co-occurring mental and substance abuse disorders. Accepts court-referred clients. Assessment required for program placement.
resources.fees: Accepts Drug Medi-Cal, insurance. Licensed by CA DHCS, Drug Medi-Cal certified
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Phoenix Halfway House Venice 503 Ocean Front Walk substance abuse'

resources.name: California Department of Rehabilitation - Norwalk
resources.description: State agency providing vocational rehabilitation services to help job seekers with disabilities obtain competitive employment in integrated work settings. Offers independent living services including peer support, skill development, systems advocacy, assistive technology, transition services, housing assistance, and personal assistance services. Serves students with disabilities aged 16-21.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Job seekers with disabilities seeking competitive employment. Students with disabilities aged 16-21 eligible for transition services. Serves Commerce, Norwalk, and East Los Angeles areas.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'California Department of Rehabilitation Norwalk 11000 Firestone address phone services'

resources.name: Norwalk Career Center
resources.description: California State Employment Development Department career center providing comprehensive employment services including job search assistance, career counseling, skills assessments, resume development, and connections to training programs. Serves Norwalk and surrounding Southeast Los Angeles County communities.
services_offered: Job listings and labor market information
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Norwalk and Southeast Los Angeles County. Services available to individuals with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Norwalk Downey California reentry services employment'

resources.name: South Bay One-Stop Career Center - Hawthorne Teen Center
resources.description: Youth-focused workforce development center providing employment services, job training, and career support for young adults ages 14-24 in the South Bay region. Part of South Bay Workforce Investment Board network offering WIA youth programs and comprehensive career services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 14-24 in South Bay area including El Segundo, Gardena, Hawthorne, Hermosa Beach, Inglewood, Lawndale, Lennox, Manhattan Beach, Redondo Beach, and Westchester.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Hawthorne YouthSource Center employment youth services address phone'

notes: Seventh research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Geographic diversity: Inglewood (2), Compton (2), Hawthorne (2), Venice (3), Santa Monica (1), Gardena (1), Crenshaw/West Adams (1), Norwalk (2), Downtown LA (1). Service focus: employment centers (7), housing (5), substance abuse (1), general support (3), youth services (1), disability services (1). All contact information verified from organization websites and government sources.
